content.raw:
Ok I see.

I agree with @sloretz that rules like these should be explicit in the style guide; I also didn't know this was a rule, and I suspect no one else who has worked on this repo and approved the current code knew it either - otherwise we would have fixed it. Based on the fact that the present style is actually found on other Ignition projects, "setters must be prefixed by Set" sounds like a new rule to me.

I'd like to point out that it can be quite cumbersome for downstream projects to handle tick-tock deprecation. Making the rules clear upfront to the whole team would decrease the number of times we go through deprecation cycles because of style, thus decreasing the barrier to adoption of our libraries.
